page.title: 19Hellesdon's Library
page.content: The library was built in 1960 and has a total membership of 6,000 people.The librarian (Mr.Wright) has access to 23,000 books.The library was visited by 500 children in"Children's week". There is a range of books for all ages,from story books to factual books,and there are braille books for the blind.There is a "Friend Of The Library" scheme which raises money to pay for spoken word cassettes. They have a microfiche which helps you to find your book.The library has 6 cubicules for private study. So many people used the library they had to build an extension. This extension was built in 1977.
